property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: After [[Ralsei]] explains how to get through battles to [[Kris]], they enter through The Great Door to commence their adventure.

property.name: page
property.value: Castle Town

object.name: The Field of Hopes and Dreams

property.name: description
property.value: When entering this room, an indicator that the song "The Field of Hopes and Dreams" is currently playing will appear.

property.name: page
property.value: Field of Hopes and Dreams

property.name: description
property.value: [[Lancer]] warns the [[party]] that proceeding further will have his troops attack.

property.name: description
property.value: When [[Kris]] and [[Ralsei]] walk towards [[Susie]], they will find her complaining about the door not opening. Ralsei tells Susie that in order to progress, she will have to help them solve the puzzle in the previous room. This will cause Susie to join the [[party]], with a long fanfare playing in the background. When the fanfare ends, Susie will walk away to follow at a distance at which she doesn't seem to be associated, which cause the fanfare to play again but slower.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Ralsei]] tries to explain to [[Susie]] that as heroes, they can go by through battles peacefully, explaining how they can make enemies tired to PACIFY them. Susie dismisses Ralsei's words, and instead makes fun of him. Ralsei then whispers to [[Kris]] how they should WARN enemies of her attacks.

property.name: description
property.value: Walking to the right progresses the story into the Great Board.

property.name: page
property.value: Great Board

properties.property: Reaching the Forest Warp Door will activate this Warp Door. It can be used to travel to the following locations: * Forest * Bake Sale * Castle

Seam runs a shop here that they call a "Seap". Inside this shop, they sell the following items: * [[Dark Dollar]] * [[Darkburger]] * [[Amber Card]] * [[Spookysword]]
Seam can also be talked to about the Strange Prisoner in the basement of [[Card Castle]], and will give [[Broken Key A]] to start the process of unlocking his cell, as well as giving a hint for [[Broken Key B]].

property.name: description
property.value: The Donation Hole allows [[Kris]] to insert money into it. Upon inserting 1 [[Dark Dollar]], the donation whole will become "Full."

property.name: description
property.value: The path ahead is blocked by spikes. [[Kris]] and [[Ralsei]] must press the buttons in the right order before the time runs out to proceed. Kris has to press the button on the right, followed by both it and the upper button with the help of Ralsei, followed by pressing both lower buttons together.

property.name: description
property.value: This is another timed puzzle where the [[party]] must step on the right tiles in the right order within the time provided. Solving the puzzle unlocks the door in the next room. However, the final step of the puzzle requires three tiles to be pressed, which is impossible with just [[Kris]] and [[Ralsei]]. If they keep failing at it, Ralsei will tell Kris that they might be missing something, and ask you to continue to the next room. [[Susie]] can temporarily join the party there to aid with this puzzle so she can also get through. The puzzle requires pressing the tile to the right first, the two tiles on the top, and finally all three tiles on the right.

property.name: description
property.value: Upon walking into this room, [[Ralsei]] exclaims his excitement for another puzzle, with [[Susie]] expressing the opposite reaction. Ralsei tries to read the instructions, but they were vandalized by someone signing with [[Rouxls Kaard|RK]]. In order to solve the puzzle, Kris needs to move the boxes onto the two opposite upper corners by using the Confirm button.

property.name: description
property.value: To lower the spikes to the right of the puzzle, Kris must enther the suites in the same oreder as the suits represented by the rooms in [[Card Castle]], from bottom to top. This order is Diamond, Heart, Club, and Spade. The in game order would be Diamond, Swap, Diamond, Spade, Swap and finally Spade.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Lancer]] tells [[Ralsei]] and [[Kris]] that [[Susie]] beat him up, so he fled. Interacting again causes him to tell them that Susie went to the right. If Kris interacts with him after his warning, Ralsei will ask him for his troops not to fight him, to which Lancer will reply that "thrashing is what makes their relationship work."

property.name: description
property.value: Top Chef warns [[Kris]] and [[Ralsei]] about how [[Susie]] ravaged his cake, informing the heroes on the direction she went. Interacting with him later with Susie will have him scared of her, to which she responds by asking him if he would like her to spit the cake out.

property.name: page
property.value: Top Chef

property.name: description
property.value: A Jigsawry that has been clobbered, presumably by Susie.

property.name: description
property.value: The treasure chest contains a White Ribbon. Since this is the first ARMOR in the game, [[Ralsei]] explains that [[Kris]] can wear it through the [[Equipment|EQUIPMENT]] menu. He has special dialogue if Kris gives the ribbon to him.

property.name: page
property.value: White Ribbon

property.name: description
property.value: The Jigsawry warns [[Kris]] and [[Ralsei]] that [[Susie]] has been going around clobbering every enemy. They tells them that they do not enjoy fighting, and that they only do since the [[King]] forces them to.

property.name: description
property.value: After the battle with the [[Hathy]]s ends, Lancer runs away. However, Lancer chooses not go very far, and interacting with him here causes him to tell the [[party]] that he has finished running away..

property.name: description
property.value: Jigsaw Joe asks if [[Kris]] wants to purchase a tutorial for 50 Dark Dollars. If Kris does not have enough, he still offers to aid the party. If Kris repeatedly declines, Jigsaw Joe lowers the price to 1D$, and [[Ralsei]] offers to pay instead. Regardless of outcome, he leads them to the next room.

property.name: page
property.value: Jigsaw Joe

property.name: description
property.value: Jigsaw Joe explains that the Jigsaw pieces usually make puzzle, but when the [[King]] took hold, he replaced them with [[Rouxls Kaard]]. The Jigsaws are now forced to make tutorials to make money.

property.name: page
property.value: Jigsaw Joe

properties.property: TP Master will give [[Kris]] tutorials on [[TP]]. They can provide information on the following topics: * '''What's TP''': TP Master will tell Kris that TP allows for casting spells and that it stands for "Toilet Paper." [[Ralsei]] corrects them by explaining that it stands for Tension Points. * '''Gaining TP''': TP Master explains how the party can earnt TP by DEFENDing or by grazing bullets. * '''Secret''': TP Master tells Kris that TP only lasts in battle, and as such, it is useless to save up TP for after the battle. Ralsei then points out that leftover TP will award extra [[Dark Dollars]].

Ralsei Master gives [[Kris]] tutorials on [[Ralsei]]. They can provide information on the following topics: * '''Pacify''': Ralsei Master jokingly suggests that Pacify should be used to put babies to sleep before they cry. Ralsei corrects them and states that pacify should be used on TIRED enemies to [[SPARE]] them. * '''Healing''': Ralsei Master mentions that Ralsei has a healing spell, but is confused on its utility. Ralsei explains that the spell can be used to avoid consuming items in battle. * '''Fact''': Ralsei Master claims that Ralsei loves when Kris donates to them, and that he will hug them if they do. Ralsei objects, noting that money is not necessary for him to give hugs.

property.name: page
property.value: Field/NPCs#Ralsei Master

properties.property: Susie Master gives [[Kris]] tutorials on [[Susie]]. They can provide information on the following topics: * '''Warning''': Susie Master explains that Kris's WARNING ACT will prevent Susie from damaging enemies. Susie intergects that this means there is no reason to use the ACT. If Susie is absent, they instead mention that "WARNing is obsolete." Once Susie listens in battle, Susie Master comments that WARNing is no longer necessary. * '''Attack''': Susie Master Informs Kris that Susie automatically attacks the topmost enemy during an encounter. If Susie is not in the party, they instead acknowledge her absence. Once Susie joins the party "for real," they state that Susie's Rude Buster deals more damage when pressing the CONFIRM key. * '''Fact''': Susie Master suggests that Susie wants the party to donate to the Donation Hole. She disagrees. If Susie is absent, Susie Master wonders if the two can "pick up the slackts." Once Susie listens in battle, Susie Master is impressed by her personal growth.

property.name: page
property.value: Field/NPCs#Susie Mster

properties.property: Kris Master Gives [[Kris]] tutorials on Kris. They can provide information on the following topics: * '''Reviving''': Kris Master explains that Healing Items and Spells can revive downed party members, and that the [[Revive Mint]] can fully heal a downed party member. * '''Acting''': Kris Master explains how only Kris can ACT, whereas other party members cannot. Ralsei interjects that he can SPARE or Pacify an opponent on the same turn that Kris ACTs, if that ACT makes the enemy Sparable or Tired. * '''Fact''': Kris Master encourages the party to donate to the "Donation Hole." They also mention that they used to have a box for donations, though it was stolen.

property.name: page
property.value: Field/NPCs#Kris Master

property.name: description
property.value: [[Ralsei]] directs [[Kris]] to the puzzle and tells them that they should push the blocks onto the pressure plates.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Susie]] tells [[Kris]] that puzzles are their job to solve.

properties.property: With the door closed behind you, your adventure will truly begin... The power of adventures shines within you.

property.name: description
property.value: SAVE Point in the Maze of Death

properties.property: Susie, the violet tormentor, is now your ally. The power of mean girls shines within you.
(Enemies ahead! You're gonna die!) (SIGNED, LANCER)
(If you're reading this... I guess you're dead.) (SIGNED, LANCER)
(Hey, don't read this sign! It's a work in progress!) (SIGNED, LANCER)
(These types of trees DON'T contain an item that can heal you.) (Whatever you do, DON'T check the tree and use [Menu Key] to open your menu!) (You got it!?) (SIGNED, LANCER)
Check the clock. In order to solve this puzzle, you'll have to hurry.
(Behold, the Maze of Death! (Prepare to GET LOST, clowns!!!) (SIGNED, LANCER)
(Feeling lost yet!? You must be UTTERLY HELPLESS among these twists and turns!) (Your sense of direction won't save you now!) (SIGNED, LANCER)
(Hey, wait!! Where am I!? Help! Somebody help! I'm lost!!) (SIGNED, LANCER)
(Hey, don't look! This sign's private!) (SIGNED, LANCER)
(Oh, it's just this way.) (SIGNED, LANCER)
(Heheheheh!!! I sneaked by and made a sign!!) (SIGNED, LANCER)
"Hole Goals" $1 - Monthly tutorial, weekly. $10 - Weekly tutorial, monthly. $100 - Stop making tutorials.

(From the bottom, the order of our rooms in Card Castle.) (Of course, if you haven't been there, you won't know it.)
(Really emphasizing that it's impossible if you haven't been there...)

property.name: description
property.value: Tree that gives a [[Dark Candy]] when interacted with. It can be interacted with again to get another one.

property.name: page
property.value: Dark Candy

property.name: description
property.value: Interacting with the Broken Cake will allow [[Kris]] to take a piece of it.

property.name: page
property.value: Broken Cake

property.name: description
property.value: Tree that gives a [[Dark Candy]] when interacted with. It can be interacted with again to get another one.

property.name: page
property.value: Dark Candy

property.name: description
property.value: The treasure chest contains Broken Key C.

property.name: page
property.value: Broken Key C

property.name: description
property.value: Enemy encounter consisting of a Rudinn.

property.name: description
property.value: Enemy encounter consisting of two Rudinns.

property.name: description
property.value: Enemy encounter consisting of a Rudinn and [[Hathy]].

property.name: description
property.value: Lancer turns to face towards [[Kris]] and [[Ralsei]] and congratulates them on finishing the maze. He then challenges the team to fight against a team consisting of three [[Hathy]]s. Lancer is confused on why his team's attack did not work, to which Ralsei informs him that Hathy is purely a support enemy.

property.name: description
property.value: C. Round was intended to act as a tutorial boss fight for [[Susie]], with Ralsei intending to teach her how to ACT. However, if [[Kris]] attempts to involve Susie in ACTing, she will immediately attack the enemy, making them flee.

property.name: page
property.value: C. Round

property.name: description
property.value: Lancer turns to face towards the [[party]] and tells them that he has prepared a new battle team since the last time they faced him. Lancer laughs, which causes [[Susie]] to make fun of his evil laugh and threaten him. Lancer takes what he learned from Susie's threatening to thank her and run off with his new evil laugh, while deploying his team of [[Jigsawry]]s.

property.name: description
property.value: Enemy encounter consisting of two Rudinns and [[Hathy]].

property.name: description
property.value: An enemy encounter against [[Rudinn]], [[Hathy]], and [[Jigsawry]]
